name: Mezz Mezzrow
description: '''Milton Mesirow''' (November 9, 1899 – August 5, 1972), better known as '''Mezz Mezzrow''', was an American [[jazz]] [[clarinet]]ist and [[saxophone|saxophonist]] from [[Chicago]], [[Illinois]]. He is remembered for organizing and financing recording sessions with [[Tommy Ladnier]] and [[Sidney Bechet]]. He recorded with Bechet as well and briefly acted as manager for [[Louis Armstrong]]. Mezzrow is equally known as a colorful character, as portrayed in his autobiography, ''Really the Blues'' (which takes its title from a Bechet composition), co-written with [[Bernard Wolfe]] and published in 1946.
